name: Noah Pierre
comment: I'm a bit unclear about how condensation forms in the water cycle. Can someone break it down?

replies.name: Skill Sprout
replies.comment: Condensation happens when water vapor cools down and changes back into liquid droplets. It’s the step before precipitation. The example with the glass of ice water in the video was a great visual!

name: Mollie Hall
comment: I really enjoyed today’s lesson on the water cycle! The animations made the processes so much easier to grasp.

name: Lyle Kauffman
comment: How do we measure the amount of water vapor in the air? Is it something we'll cover later?

replies.name: Amanda Lowery
replies.comment: Yes, I think we'll dive deeper into that in the next module on humidity. But the short answer is: we measure it using a tool called a hygrometer.

replies.name: Owen Garcia
replies.comment: Exactly! The next lesson will cover humidity, and I’m excited to see how it all connects back to the water cycle.
